ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Topics in Human Investigation is a class that introduces you to structure-based drug design and clinical trials. I would recommend it. It is a really interesting class for anyone interested in how drugs are designed, tested, and approved.
This class is definitely worth taking if you're thinking about pharmacology and drug development, as it offers you a broad overview of many aspects, and really helps you think about those things.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course provided me with the foundation to understand both clinical trial data and drug design studies. It will help me to read and understand papers in these areas that are relevant to my dissertation/research.

This class wasn't very applicable to my major (MB&B), but it did offer a lot more that I hope to use in the future, because I think I'd like to go into pharmacology. The end goal of my research is to isolate active compounds from natural products, but as I'm not there yet, this class doesn't help much with my research right now, but it should help if I get a bit farther.
